title: Duplicate errors on mismatched types on constrained structs

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
Given the following code: https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=7b2b481886eb53caf9f83d11c1c86219

```rust
trait Uwu {}
struct Owo<T> where Owo<T>: Uwu { x: T }
impl Uwu for Owo<bool> {}

fn main() {
    let x: Owo<u8> = Owo { x: 0 };
}
```

The current output is:

```
error[[E0277]](https://doc.rust-lang.org/stable/error-index.html#E0277): the trait bound `Owo<u8>: Uwu` is not satisfied
 --> src/main.rs:6:12
  |
6 |     let x: Owo<u8> = Owo { x: 0};
  |            ^^^^^^^ the trait `Uwu` is not implemented for `Owo<u8>`
  |
  = help: the trait `Uwu` is implemented for `Owo<bool>`
note: required by a bound in `Owo`
 --> src/main.rs:2:29
  |
2 | struct Owo<T> where Owo<T>: Uwu { x: T }
  |                             ^^^ required by this bound in `Owo`

error[[E0308]](https://doc.rust-lang.org/stable/error-index.html#E0308): mismatched types
 --> src/main.rs:6:31
  |
6 |     let x: Owo<u8> = Owo { x: 0};
  |                               ^ expected `bool`, found integer

error[[E0308]](https://doc.rust-lang.org/stable/error-index.html#E0308): mismatched types
 --> src/main.rs:6:22
  |
6 |     let x: Owo<u8> = Owo { x: 0};
  |            -------   ^^^^^^^^^^^ expected `u8`, found `bool`
  |            |
  |            expected due to this
  |
  = note: expected struct `Owo<u8>`
             found struct `Owo<bool>`
```

At least some of those errors shouldn't be emitted, especially the second one is pretty confusing.

This is because of the `Owo<T>: Uwu` bound on the struct. Because `Uwu` is only implemented for `bool`, type inference uses that knowledge (it arguably shouldn't but that's a differnt topic :D) to know that every `Owo<_>` must actually be `Owo<bool>, so it infers the right hand side to be of type `Owo<bool>`. This causes two unnecessary errors.
